text: {"answer":"M","reasoning":"i is incorrect because Swiss federal statutes cannot be annulled by the Federal Supreme Court (no abstract constitutional review of federal acts; Art. 190 BV binds courts). ii is incorrect because under participation in acquired property, inheritances are part of a spouseâ€™s own property (Eigengut), i.e., they do comprise inherited property. iii is incorrect because the Helvetic Republic replaced (did not restore) the old confederate structure with a centralized unitary state. iv is incorrect because \"Das moderne Kriegsrecht\" (1866) is associated with Johann Caspar Bluntschli, not Gustave Moynier. v is incorrect because in concrete/indirect review the decision is annulled, but the underlying legal provision is generally not annulled (at most set aside in the case)."}
